edu.jhu.hlt.concrete.concurrent

Class ConcurrentCommunicationLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.jhu.hlt.concrete.concurrent.ConcurrentCommunicationLoader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class ConcurrentCommunicationLoader
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    This class can be used to load Communication objects from disk in parallel.
    Author:
    max

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConcurrentCommunicationLoader()
      No arg ctor: use Runtime to determine number of threads to use via call to availableProcessors().
      ConcurrentCommunicationLoader(int nThreads)
      Single arg ctor: pass in the desired number of threads.

    • Method Detail

      • bulkLoad

        public List<Future<edu.jhu.hlt.concrete.Communication>> bulkLoad(Path pathToCommFiles)
                                                          throws FileNotFoundException
        Deserialize Communication objects in parallel.

        The ExecutorCompletionService guarantees that the objects are returned in the order that they are queued. In other words, one can safely iterate over the returned object and wait without truly blocking.
        Parameters:
        pathToCommFiles - - path to a text file containing paths on disk to serialized Communication files.
        Returns:
        a List of Future objects with a Communication expected.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if the passed in Path does not exist on disk.

      • bulkLoad

        public List<Future<edu.jhu.hlt.concrete.Communication>> bulkLoad(String pathToCommFilesString)
                                                          throws FileNotFoundException
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException

      • fromBytes

        public Future<edu.jhu.hlt.concrete.Communication> fromBytes(byte[] bytes)

      • close

        public void close()
           throws Exception
        When called, shutdown the ExecutorService object and block until it is finished running.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        Exception
